```{R packages, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#	LOAD PACKAGES
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
library(readr)          # read in data
library(tidyr)	        # tidy data science
library(plyr)           # data manipulations
library(dplyr)         # data manipulations
library(ggplot2)        # pretty graphing
library(RColorBrewer)   # pretty color schemes
library(pander)         # used to report session settings
```

```{R data, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#	LOAD DATA FROM FILES
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

colleges <- read_csv("data/grad_survey_colleges.csv")
degrees <- read_csv("data/grad_survey_degrees.csv")
questions <- read_csv("data/grad_survey_questions.csv")

```

```{R processing, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#	PROCESS THE DATA FOR PLOTTING
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

totals <- ddply(colleges, "year", numcolwise(sum))

totalVec <- NULL
for (i in 1:6) {
	totalVec <- c(totalVec,rep(totals[i,2],9))
}
colleges$percent <- round(colleges$responses/totalVec*100,1)
colleges <- colleges %>%
	group_by(year) %>%
	mutate(pos=cumsum(percent)-0.5*percent)

totalDegrees <- ddply(degrees, "year", numcolwise(sum))
totalDegreeVec <- NULL
for (i in 1:6) {
	totalDegreeVec <- c(totalDegreeVec,rep(totalDegrees[i,2],4))
}
degrees$percent <- round(degrees$responses/totalDegreeVec*100,1)
degrees <- degrees %>%
	group_by(year) %>%
	mutate(pos=cumsum(percent)-0.5*percent)

```

# Abstract {#abstract -}
> "Assessment is not a spreadsheet; it's a conversation."
> --- Irmeli Halinen

Student satisfaction data from the Ferris post-graduation surveys were compared from the 2010/2011 to 2015/2016 academic years. Over this timespan, the number of student respondents has noticeably improved. The lowest return rate (17%) was obtained in 2010/2011 and the highest (27%) was collected in 2015/2016. The average number of responses was `r round(mean(totals$responses),0)` per year for this interval. 

# Introduction {#introduction -}


# Methods {#methods -}

## Data collection {#data -}
All registration records for the fall of 2017 were collated and de-identified. The data file, 'registrations.csv', contains only the course name (e.g. BIOL 101), the core competency (e.g. Natural Sciences), and the standardized measure (e.g. Selected Response Exam). The datafile is [available here](data/registrations.csv).

# Results and Discussion {#results -}  



## Response rate by year {#responses -}
```{R responses, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.cap="Total number of student survey responses per academic year"}

#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#	NUMBER OF RESPONSES PER ACADEMIC YEAR
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ggplot(data = totals, aes(x=year, y=responses, label=responses)) +
	geom_bar(stat="identity", colour="black", fill="firebrick") +
	scale_y_continuous(limits=c(0,1200), breaks=c(0,200,400,600,800,1000,1200), name="Total Responses") +
	geom_text(fontface = "bold", size = 6, position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), color="white") +
	theme_linedraw() +
	xlab("Academic Year") +
	theme(text = element_text(size=15))

```


## Response rate by degree earned {#degrees -}
```{R degrees, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.cap="Percent of student survey responses by degree earned per academic year"}

#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#	NUMBER OF RESPONSES BY DEGREE EARNED
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

myColors1 <- brewer.pal(4, "Set3")
ggplot(data = degrees, aes(x=year, y=percent, group=Degree, fill=Degree)) +
	geom_bar(position=position_stack(reverse = TRUE), stat="identity", color="black")+
	scale_y_continuous(limits=c(0,100.5), breaks=c(0,20,40,60,80,100), name="Percent Valid Responses") +
	geom_text(data=subset(degrees, percent>5), aes(y=pos, label=paste(percent,"%",sep="")), size=4, fontface = "bold") +
	scale_fill_manual(values=myColors1) +
	theme_linedraw() +
	xlab("Academic Year") +
	theme(text = element_text(size=13), legend.position="top",legend.box="horizontal")

```

## Response rate by college {#colleges -}
```{R colleges, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.cap="Percent of student survey responses by academic college per academic year"}

#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#	NUMBER OF RESPONSES BY ACADEMIC COLLEGE
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

myColors2 <- brewer.pal(9, "Set3")
ggplot(data = colleges, aes(x=year, y=percent, group=College, fill=College)) +
	geom_bar(position=position_stack(reverse = TRUE), stat="identity", color="black")+
	scale_y_continuous(limits=c(0,100), breaks=c(0,20,40,60,80,100), name="Percent Valid Responses") +
	geom_text(data=subset(colleges, percent>5), aes(y=pos, label=paste(percent,"%",sep="")), size=4, fontface = "bold") +
	scale_fill_manual(values=myColors2) +
	theme_linedraw() +
	xlab("Academic Year") +
	theme(text = element_text(size=13), legend.position="top",legend.box="horizontal")

```

## Overall satisfaction ratings {#Q1 -}
```{R question1, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.cap="I am satisfied with the quality of education that I received at FSU/KCAD."}

#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#	STUDENT RESPONSES TO SURVEY QUESTION 1
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

plot1 <- questions %>%
	filter(item==1)

plot1$'1: Strongly Disagree' <- round((plot1$level1)/totals$responses*100,1)
plot1$'2: Somewhat Disagree' <- round((plot1$level2)/totals$responses*100,1)
plot1$'3: Somewhat Agree'    <- round((plot1$level3)/totals$responses*100,1)
plot1$'4: Strongly Agree'    <- round((plot1$level4)/totals$responses*100,1)
plot1$'Total positive (3+4)' <- plot1$`4: Strongly Agree`+plot1$`3: Somewhat Agree`

plot1 %>%
	gather(Attitude,responses, '1: Strongly Disagree':'Total positive (3+4)') %>%
	ggplot(aes(x=year, y=responses, group=Attitude, colour=Attitude)) +                   # Plot percentages by year
	scale_linetype_manual(values = c(1,1,1,1,2)) +                                        # Line styles
	geom_line(aes(linetype=Attitude), size=1) +                                           # Set line thickness
	geom_point(fill="white",shape=21, size=4, stroke=1) +                                 # Style the points
	scale_color_manual(values=c("#e4572e", "#f3a712", "#a8c686", "#669bbc","#000000")) +  # Line colors
	scale_y_continuous(limits=c(0,100), breaks=c(0,20,40,60,80,100)) +                    # Scale y axis
	ylab("Percent Valid Responses") +                                                     # Y axis label
	xlab("Year") +                                                                        # X axis label
	theme_linedraw() +
	xlab("Academic Year") +
	theme(text = element_text(size=12), legend.position="top", legend.direction="vertical")


```

## Recommendation of Ferris/KCAD {#Q21 -}
```{R question21, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.cap="Since graduating, how often have you recommended FSU/KCAD to prospective students?"}

#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#	STUDENT RESPONSES TO SURVEY QUESTION 21
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

plot1 <- questions %>%
	filter(item==21)

plot1$'1: Never' <- round((plot1$level1)/totals$responses*100,1)
plot1$'2: Once or twice' <- round((plot1$level2)/totals$responses*100,1)
plot1$'3: A few times'    <- round((plot1$level3)/totals$responses*100,1)
plot1$'4: Often'    <- round((plot1$level4)/totals$responses*100,1)
plot1$'Total positive (3+4)' <- plot1$`4: Often`+plot1$`3: A few times`

plot1 %>%
	gather(Recommended,responses, '1: Never':'Total positive (3+4)') %>%
	ggplot(aes(x=year, y=responses, group=Recommended, colour=Recommended)) +              # Plot percentages by year
	scale_linetype_manual(values = c(1,1,1,1,2)) +                                        # Line styles
	geom_line(aes(linetype=Recommended), size=1) +                                        # Set line thickness
	geom_point(fill="white",shape=21, size=4, stroke=1) +                                 # Style the points
	scale_color_manual(values=c("#e4572e", "#f3a712", "#a8c686", "#669bbc","#000000")) +  # Line colors
	scale_y_continuous(limits=c(0,100), breaks=c(0,20,40,60,80,100)) +                    # Scale y axis
	ylab("Percent Valid Responses") +                                                     # Y axis label
	xlab("Year") +                                                                        # X axis label
	theme_linedraw() +
	xlab("Academic Year") +
	theme(text = element_text(size=12), legend.position="top", legend.direction="vertical")


```
